turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Jesus, that's beautiful.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: If you're this goddamn smart, how did you ever get caught?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Every job like this has moments where things don't go so well and everyone starts thinking about their own ass. It's in those moments that everything comes together or falls apart.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I had a partner and she fucked me.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I won't.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I think we're going to find out.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: He totally freaked.  I've never seen him like this.  He's out of his fucking mind.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: That's okay, as long as he believes it was Johnnie.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Believes it!  Jesus, it's driving him crazy.  He wants to kill him.  I don't know, Corky, I don't know what he is going to do.  I'm getting nervous, really nervous.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: It's all right, Violet.  It's working. All we got to do is wait him out and see what he does.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What if he doesn't run?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: That means he probably will kill Johnnie.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh, Christ, I got to get out of here!

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Listen, if he doesn't run, all you have to do is break down, go to your bedroom and pack some things, start crying, saying you love him but you can't do it.  You're sorry but you have to leave and just walk out.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: okay, all right.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: We're almost there, Violet.  just hang on.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh, thank God.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I'm still here.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I was so afraid you ...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You don't quit on me, Violet, and I won't quit on you.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm sorry, Corky ...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Don't be sorry.  Help me.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: How'd it go?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm here, aren't I?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You know what the difference is between us, Violet?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: ...  Me neither.

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Hey, Caesar!  You take care of this girl, or I find out!

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: You are as radiant as ever, Violet.

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: No, Johnnie.  No goddamned phones. Not now.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Pop?

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Caesar, come here.  Sit.  We talk now.  You too, Johnnie.

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Done.  We go now.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Pop.  You got two hours until your plane leaves.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Unbelievable.  Can you believe that, Violet?

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Hey, Johnnie ...

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Johnnie, what did I say?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Pop, this is important to me.  It's a simple question.  if he would just answer the question, that's the end of it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You shouldn't have to see this.  Why don't you get out of here?  Go for a walk.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar wants me to stay.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Don't worry about Caesar.  I'll handle Caesar.  You just get out of here, okay?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh, God.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Caesar?  What the fuck time is it?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Mickey?  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Violet, it's Gino and Johnnie.  They were in a car accident.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh my God.  Was anyone hurt?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I think everything is okay.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Mickey!  Oh God, Mickey!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Violet?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I will never understand it, Mickey. You didn't even call the police.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I told you, the family doesn't want the police around.  We want to take care of it ourselves and we will. I'll find him.  I swear I will.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I know you will.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Sure you're going to be okay?  I mean, if you're having second thoughts, my offer still stands.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Thanks, Mickey, but I need to get out, you know?  Get away from all of this.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Storm clouds are gathering, Ted. It looks like rain and I don't have a thing to wear.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: I don't know what we're talking about.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: We're talking about Marseille. We're talking about Nykwana Wombosi. And I'm asking you if this abortion in Marseille has anything to do with Treadstone.  Was this Treadstone?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: You're asking me a direct question?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: I thought you were never going to do that.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: They're putting together an agency oversight committee.  They're going to look through everyone's budgets. Treadstone is a rather sizable line item in my ledger.  What am I going to do about that?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: You'd want to make that go away. You'd want to remind them that Treadstone is a training organization.  That it's all theoretical.  You'd want to sign off on that.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: And what if I couldn't do that?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Then I'd have to explain Treadstone. And you'd have to explain how you let me get this far.  Doesn't sound like much of a Plan-B, does it?  We'll clean up the field.  You clean up your budgets.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: She's a gypsy.  If it's a cover, it's a great one.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I'm assuming we're exploring that possibility.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: We're exploring <u>every</u> possibility.  We are in pursuit.  How much more do you want me to tell you?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Pursuit would indicate that you know exactly where he is.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: No.  Pursuit <u>ends</u> when we know exactly where he is.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Yes, well, I think we need some fresh eyes on this problem.  I'm bringing in some people from upstairs.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: We've been down here for two weeks banging our heads against the wall. We've been <u>sleeping</u> down here.  We just got our first lead fourteen hours ago, and now? -- now that we <u>finally</u> have something to work with -- you want to bring planning personnel down here?  I'd rethink that.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I want a second opinion.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: <u>This is an operations desk</u>.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I'm not asking.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: That was two hours -- two hours to get a second opinion -- and nothing changes.  He's loose.  He's out of control.  It's very clear what needs to happen.  I have work to do.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: What if he <u>is</u> working for someone else?  What if he turned?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Turn?  To who?  Where does he turn? What does he have to offer?  He's got nothing.  He's a killer.  He's a piece of equipment for crissake. Where's he gonna turn?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: No.  We can't risk it.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Our last sighting was forty-eight hours ago.  Even if they stayed in the car, the grid is huge.  This is it.  He's trained -- conditioned -- they're built to disappear.  You give him another day to run and we may never find him.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: This doesn't go upstairs.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: -- he went inside! --

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: -- if we can get a clean shot --

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: -- <u>inside</u> the house? --

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: -- that's what they're trained for -- just a surgical strike.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: We don't know what we're into!

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: We're in the shitter, man!  Pick your poison.  Maybe he's in there to finish the job.  Maybe he's working for Wombosi.  Maybe they want to go on TV together.  Every possibility sucks -- we've got to move!

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: I'm going to Paris.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: <u>No you're not</u>.  You're not going anywhere.  I'm shutting this down.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: You're not doing shit.  You're so scared you can't even think.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: You just blew up a house in Paris! This program is over.  Call it off.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: I can't call it off.  He's not responding.  Get out of my way.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I won't ask again.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I work alone.  Like you...  ...we always work alone.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Who are you?  Rome?  Paris?  Treadstone...both of us...I was warned but...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Treadstone?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...which one are you?...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Paris.  I live in Paris...

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...headaches...you have that...I get such bad headaches...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...it's a problem...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Treadstone.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...or in a car...when it's dark...something with the headlights...  ...pills, right?  Treadstone had those pills...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What is Treadstone?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...what did you do?...you must've really fucked up...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...someone said caffeine -- for a headache...doesn't seem...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What do they want me to do?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...they won't let you go...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Are you Treadstone?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Am I Treadstone?  Me?  What the hell're you talking about?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: <u>What did you do to me</u>?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What did I do?  I spent thirty million dollars on you.  I spent three years finding you -- four years training you --  What did I do?  What in the name of God have you been doing, Jason?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: They're right about you, aren't they?  You're fried.  You really don't know what's going on, do you?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I know you've been trying to kill me.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Of course.  We had to try.  We didn't know what was wrong.  We didn't know you were in trouble.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: So now you know.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: So it's time to go home.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: That's all I get?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: We'll make you better.  We can put the pieces back.  We can do that.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: We have to go home, Jason.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Jason Bourne is dead.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: <u>There never was a Jason Bourne</u>.  You have to come with me.  It's the only way.  We can give it back to you...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Keep it.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Jason...  They can't let you go...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: That'll be their second worst mistake.

turns.speaker: WOMBOSI
turns.text: Did you bring investment advice for me tonight?  It was tax shelters, wasn't it?  Swiss debenture-swaps.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: MPG Capital.

turns.speaker: WOMBOSI
turns.text: I think investment advice from a dead man, it's a bad idea.  How does it feel to be dead?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It's a lot more stressful than I thought.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Who do you think sent me?

turns.speaker: WOMBOSI
turns.text: I know who sent you.  I don't know why.  I learned many, many things from the CIA.  <u>Many</u> things.  I learned the way they think.  Was the bomb on my boat supposed to go off or not?

turns.speaker: WOMBOSI
turns.text: <u>Was this a game or a fuck up</u>?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: WOMBOSI
turns.text: Get the kids out!

turns.speaker: WOMAN CLERK
turns.text: You're a U.S. Citizen?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes.  I mean, I think so.  Yes.  Yes...

turns.speaker: WOMAN CLERK
turns.text: Well, either you are, or you aren't.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: WOMAN CLERK
turns.text: You have your passport?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I have a passport.  I've got...  Actually, it's a little complicated.

turns.speaker: WOMAN CLERK
turns.text: <u>Do you have your passport, sir</u>?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look, maybe I should just...

turns.speaker: WOMAN CLERK
turns.text: Sir, you waited on line.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yeah, I know...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: ...yes -- oui -- uh...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Paris?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR/PHONE
turns.text: Yes, sir...  How can I help you?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes, I'm...I'm looking for Mr. Jason Bourne.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR/PHONE
turns.text: One moment, please...  I'm afraid, I have no one by that name registered, sir.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: D'accord...  Merci.  Un moment -- un moment --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- hang on -- I need you to check another name for me -- hang on -- un moment, s'il vous plait --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Kane.  Do you have Mr. John Michael Kane?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR/PHONE
turns.text: One moment, sir.

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: Bonjour?  Monsieur?  Allo...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes, I'm here...

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: You call about Monsieur Kane?  John Michael Kane?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes.  Is he there?

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: You are a friend of his?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: I have some very bad news for you, sir.  I'm terrible sorry to have to tell you this, but Monsieur Kane has passed away almost two weeks ago...

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: There was an accident.  On the motorway.  Apparently, he was killed instantly.  Really, I'm terrible sorry to be the one to tell you this...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: ...I understand...

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: ...we actually, we were unaware for several days that this had happened. When they came for his things, it was made known for us, you see?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Who?  Who came?

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: His brother.  You know his brother?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Right.  Yes.  Of course.

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: It's very bad this.  Terrible sad. Such a young man.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Do you -- his brother -- do you have a phone number?

turns.speaker: MANAGER/PHONE
turns.text: I think not...  No, I'm sorry.  It was very sudden. He was here very briefly.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: Mr. Kane...  Come right in...please...have a seat.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: Well...  I must admit, when my assistant told me you were here I was, really -- I was quite -- I was surprised.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: We thought you were gone for good.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: Well, I mean it's a tough business, isn't it?  Cutthroat.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: Look, our bid -- it was competitive -- but definitely at the high end of competitive -- when we didn't hear back from you, we did some re-analysis of the numbers, and honestly, we'd really like a chance to do a bit better.  I'm assuming you're still in the market.  It's the same vessel?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: We just picked up a job quite like the one we were bidding for you. Gorgeous boat, hundred-and-seventy- five-foot pleasure cruiser.  I think we learned a few things that might allow us to make our proposal for your job, as I said, a bit more competitive.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: Was it the break-in?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: We also thought we hadn't heard from you -- we've had a bit of a publicity nightmare, people have been talking.  Our offices were broken into -- vandalism mostly -- shortly after we last spoke.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I hadn't heard.

turns.speaker: RAWLINS
turns.text: Let me get you a new copy of the proposal.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: That'd be great.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I need a ride.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I need a ride out of here.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Oh, Jesus...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Please.  I don't want to scare you.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: It's a little late for that.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I've got a situation here and --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Get the fuck away from my car.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'll give you ten thousand dollars to drive me to Paris.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Great.  You know what?  I'll give you ten gazillion dollars to get the fuck away from me before I start screaming my head off.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You don't want the police any more than I do.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Get me out of here.  <u>Please</u>.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: So what's in Paris?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I want to go home.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: For twenty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I said ten thousand.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You have blood on your pants.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Okay.  Twenty thousand.  Ten now.  Ten there.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: <u>No</u>.  No, that was too easy --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Wait up --  -- just wait up --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- get the fuck out of here -- all this money, this crazy offer, I mean give me a fucking break with this, this is --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look, I want a ride to Paris.  That's all I want.  I swear.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You swear?  That's great.  I feel so much better now.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't want anything but a ride. All I want to do is go home.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You could buy a car for twenty grand.  You could buy this car.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't want to go alone.  I want you to drive me to Paris.  Like we're a couple.  Like we're a couple and we're travelling together.  That's all we're doing.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: And I don't get hurt.  I get twenty thousand dollars and I don't get hurt.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I won't hurt you.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What if I say no?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Then I'll find another ride.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Just so you know, if you're gonna burn me on the money, you might as well kill me.  I was supposed to have this car back three days ago.  It's not my car.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Shit --  Can I tell you how much you're freaking me out?  Okay?  Because you are -- you're completely freaking me out.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Really.  What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I don't know.  Smile.  Sneeze. Something.  You've got a bag full of money and a ride to Paris.  Fuck it, I don't know...  What kind of music do you like?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Listen to what you want.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Who pays twenty thousand dollars for a ride to Paris?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't know who I am.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Yeah, well, welcome to the club.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No.  No, I mean, I really don't know who I am.  I can't remember anything earlier than two weeks ago.  I'm serious.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What?  Like amnesia?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look, go ahead...put the radio on...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Amnesia?  You're saying you don't remember anything that happened before two weeks ago?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: That's what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: And you have no idea -- not a clue -- what came before that?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: When you think of it, before the ship -- before you wake up on the ship, what do you see?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Nothing.  It's just not there.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Well, this is great.  I'm sick of myself and you have no idea who you are.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I kept trying things, I thought if I could find all the things I could do, I could --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- you could put it together --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- which was okay for a while, I was okay with it...  But then -- there's all these other things -- all these other things I know how to do -- and this -- this stuff from the bank and...  I think something bad happened.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Sounds like you were in an accident or something.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I was shot twice in the back.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Okay, so you're a victim.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: There was a gun.  Who has a safe deposit box with a gun and all this money and all these passports?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Lots of people have guns.  You're American.  Americans love guns.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I fought my way out of an embassy. I climbed down a fifty-foot wall -- I went out the window and I was doing it -- I just did it.  I knew how to do it.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: People do amazing things when they're scared.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Why do I? -- I come in here -- instinctively -- first thing I do -- I'm looking for the exit -- I'm catching the sightlines -- I know I can't sit with my back to the door --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You're paranoid.  You were shot. It's natural.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I needed a break.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: We're about an hour away.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I can't believe I slept.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You were tired.  Here...  For twenty-thousand I like to throw in breakfast.  So what do you dream about?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I dream I'm asleep.  I dream that I'm asleep and I can't wake up.  I don't think I smoke.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You ever think maybe you have a family?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I thought about it.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Slow down.  No, don't stop.  Just...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: That's it?  Is that it?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Four-fifty.  That's the address...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Looks familiar?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No.  No.  Go around.  Keep going...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Yeah.  Pull in here.  Park it.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: So this is it, right?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I should go.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't remember any of this.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Jason...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Okay, so...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Thanks for the ride.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Anytime.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look, I don't know what's up there.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You got me pretty fucking curious.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look, you could come up.  Or you could wait if you want.  I could go check it out.  You could wait.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Nah...  With you, I mean, you'd probably just forget about me, right?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: How could I forget about you?  You're the only person I know.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: This is like a real apartment.  This is really yours?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: This is your office?  God, you live like a monk...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: All this stuff -- it's all about boats.  I think I'm in the shipping business.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: See.  It's starting to come back, yeah?  You mind if I take a bath?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- no -- Marie -- <u>no</u>! -- it's not like that --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- please -- Jason -- omigod --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- quiet -- <u>quiet</u> --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- what're you doing? -- Jason, please, tell me what's happening!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Open it --  -- do it -- what's he got in there?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: WHY ARE YOU TRYING TO KILL ME?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: ...omigod, no...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What? -- what? --  -- what is it?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: ...this is my picture... he's got my picture --  -- this is me -- this is Zurich -- this...this...this is yesterday --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- just --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- where does this come from? --  How do you have my picture?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Marie, just --  -- just stay there! -- just --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- he's got my picture! -- this is yesterday! -- this is me! --  -- where did you get my picture? --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- let me do this, okay? --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- do what? -- what are you doing? -- he's got my picture --  -- he's -- my God -- look at him -- he's bleeding to death -- my picture -- look! -- he was trying to kill us! -- omigod --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: He's dead isn't he?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Marie -- look at me -- there's no time for this --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: He went out the window -- why? -- why would someone do that?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- we can't stay here -- I can't stay here -- it's not safe here --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: He came to kill us.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- we can go -- I can get us out of here -- but we have to go now --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You knew he was coming.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I trusted you.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You're wrong.  I didn't know.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I don't trust anybody and I trusted you!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I didn't know this would happen.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: He had my picture!  He knew I was here!  He came here to kill us!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: And where is he now?  You believe what you want, but I'm telling you the truth -- I never would have brought you here if I thought it was dangerous.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Oh, Jesus...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You stay -- if you want, you stay -- it's okay -- it's better -- maybe it's better -- I don't know --  But I can't stay here.  <u>I can't</u>.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: But the police --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- there's no time --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- we'll explain it --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- there's two of us -- we'll tell them -- we'll just --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- forget it --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- we'll tell them what happened --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know what happened!  I don't know who he is!  I don't know what he wants!  I don't even know who I am!  The only thing I know is that if I stay here, I'm never gonna find out!

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You stayed there five times in the past six months.  But I didn't have time -- I could only get the bill from the last stay -- you were there for two days.  Some room service -- there's half a dozen phone calls here so that's someth--

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Who paid the bill?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: It's a company... MPG Capital.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I found it.  It took six calls.  I found Kane.  I found the body.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Let's go --  We got to get away from this phone.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- I don't know what you're doing and you're scaring me -- what are you looking for? -- what just happened in there? --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Nykwana Wombosi.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It's a name.  Mr. Wombosi owns a thirty million dollar yacht.  He's the proud owner of an Alliance Security package.  He also paid a visit to the morgue to see John Michael Kane.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What does that mean?  Jason, what does that mean?  Jason, please...who is he?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: <u>So what are we doing</u>?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Go back to the hotel.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: It doesn't matter who you were before.  It's who you want to be. That's all that matters.  We have this money.  We have what we have.  I had nothing before and now, I don't know, maybe I have more, maybe it's nothing, but...  I say we leave here.  We leave this place.  We go until we can't go anymore.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You could do that?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Yes.  That's who I want to be.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Stop where you are.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I won't let that happen.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: We have to keep moving.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: And that's it?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: If you're lucky.  Take it.  There's enough in there to make a life.  Any life.  Just get out now. Get low.  Stay low.  <u>Take it</u>.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What was I thinking, right?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I can't protect you anymore.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'm gonna find the end of this.  I can't protect you.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: This your store?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Think I could rent a scooter?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You have ID?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Where did this body go?

turns.speaker: MORGUE BOSS
turns.text: I said, someone came last night --  Look, this isn't a carnival -- people call and they make an appointment and they follow the rules -- everyone signs in and out -- this is a serious place -- serious work -- it's not just to come in whenever you like --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Shit, we didn't sign in.

turns.speaker: MORGUE BOSS
turns.text: So get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Fine.  But I'd like to sign in.  In fact, I insist on it.  Where's the book?  I gotta sign in --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Is this it? --  -- this is it, right? --

turns.speaker: MORGUE BOSS
turns.text: -- slow down -- you can't just take the book like that --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- don't sweat it, I have a pen -- no problem -- just let me find the page --  -- honey, why don't you wait for me outside, okay? --

turns.speaker: MORGUE BOSS
turns.text: -- we have rules here, this is a very serious place -- I'm the one who decides who gets in here, okay? --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- what do I? -- I put the name of the person I came to see? --

turns.speaker: MORGUE BOSS
turns.text: -- this is serious business down here and we cannot have people coming and going --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- here we go -- I found it --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Where's the dog?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: My husband's out looking for him.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: He run away often?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: That old beast?  Miss his breakfast? Not a chance.  It's always something, right?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Get in the basement.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Get everyone down in the basement.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: What the hell're you talking about?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You're in danger.  All of you.  I have no time to explain.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Wait a minute --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Miss Kreutz, please... I'm gonna have to ask you to keep your voice down.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: All the papers -- all the papers they asked for -- I brought all the papers --

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: <u>Miss Kreutz</u>, excuse me, but you entered into a fraudulent marriage in an effort to circumvent the immigration laws of the United States --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You only know that because I told you!  Ask the case officer -- find his name -- it's on the papers -- I told him all this myself! --

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: -- it's not the source of the information that's important here --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- I paid this fucking guy -- I paid him four thousand dollars -- my last four thousand dollars to marry me, okay? -- I told this to the case officer last week...  ...<u>here</u> -- Mr. Thomas.  I told Mr. Thomas I didn't know this guy was already married -- I admitted this!

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: -- Miss Kreutz, please --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- I'm the one that got ripped off! -- not you -- not the United States government -- me -- I'm the one being ripped off!

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: So now you're asking for a student visa?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: xxxxxx...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: xxxxxx

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: And that's the best angle of the courtyard?

turns.speaker: RESEARCH TECH #1
turns.text: That's the only angle.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What do they have on the streets? The area.  They must have something.

turns.speaker: RESEARCH TECH #1
turns.text: Hang on...

turns.speaker: RESEARCH TECH #1
turns.text: Sir...

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: RESEARCH TECH #1
turns.text: It's an angle of the street -- some sort of alleyway -- you can just...

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Enhance it.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: -- let's check that Interpol window again --

turns.speaker: RESEARCH TECH #1
turns.text: -- I'm on it --

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: -- I want that red car -- the girl -- we gotta get lucky here --

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Abbott wants to talk.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: Tell him we're busy.

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: I tried.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: -- and they're sure it's him? --

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: -- he accessed the account --

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: -- but it was <u>him</u> --

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: -- yes, sir, it's confirmed --

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Zurich police are looking for an American with a red bag.  Apparently he put two cops in the hospital last night.
